instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on from battery
threads.message:
Hello, one more interesting issue. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had missing battery connector and little water dmg, now everything is solved. also was some shirt under ssd I have reballed.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> present

Macbook turns on and works from charger.
when tunes on, can unplug charger and it works from battery. also can be turned off if power button from keyboard.
but if try turn on only with battery plugged, nothing happens.

what voltages should I also check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on from battery
threads.message: PPBUS voltage without battery connected? Known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on from battery
threads.message: yes on F7140 I have 8.6v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. battery is 100% ok, works on other MacBooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on from battery
threads.message: Is the battery properly recognized in OSX with charge cycles and stuff showing? Is the battery charging in OSX?
